Opcode.Description: Push Stack
Get script local variable, push it to the stack
Set script local variable

Parameter.Name: arg 1
Parameter.Description: value to push to the stack

Opcode.Description: Get scripted object variable
Set scripted object variable

Parameter.Name: arg 1
Parameter.Description: value to push to the stack

Opcode.Description: Shift Right
Shift Right
Binary OR
Binary AND
Binary XOR
Binary NOT
Logical XOR
Logical NOT
Not Equal
Greater Than
Less Than
Greater Than or Equal To
Less Than or Equal To
Push a random value to the stack
Floating point multiply and divide. Result is rounded
Duplicate value on stack

Swap two values on the stack
Duplicate List
Pop List
Random List
Returns a specified item from the argument list.
Go if Equal.
Go if Not Equal
Go if Greater Than
Go if Less Than
Go if Greater Than or Equal To
Go if Less Than or Equal To
Go if Zero

Parameter.Name: target
Parameter.Description: Address to jump to if value is zero

Opcode.Description: Go if Not Zero: also IfGoto

Parameter.Name: target
Parameter.Description: Address to jump to if value is nonzero

Opcode.Description: Go: also Goto
Ends a script and returns the specified value (if any)

Parameter.Name: lwReturn
Parameter.Description: The argument lwReturn is the value to return.

Opcode.Description: Ends a script and returns the specified value (if any).
Compares a key value to a list of argument pairs and returns the value of a match or a default value if no match is found.
Pauses a script or animation.
Opcode.Remarks: There is no way to restart a script once paused, so Pause is useful only in animations.

Opcode.Description: Start the script debugger
Destroy a GOB
Destroy this GOB
Returns the GOB ID of this GOB
Returns the GOB ID of a GOB's parent
Returns the GOB ID of this GOB's parent
Returns the GOB ID of this GOB's child
Returns True if the specified GOB exists
Send a message to a GOB
Shows a message box containing integer values. Blocks execution until the message box is closed by the user.
Runs a script contained in a GOB

Parameter.Name: lwArgCount
Parameter.Description: Number of arguments used by the script.

Parameter.Name: chidScript
Parameter.Description: Child ID of the script to run

Opcode.Description: Runs a script contained in this GOB

Parameter.Name: lwArgCount
Parameter.Description: Number of arguments used by the script.

Opcode.Description: Returns the state of this GOB
Returns the mouse's x-coordinate within a GOB in pixels.

Parameter.Name: gid
Parameter.Description: The gid argument is the GOB ID of the GOB for which to return the X mouse coordinate.

Opcode.Remarks: The x coordinate of the mouse is the horizontal distance between the referenced point of the GOB and the reference point of the mouse pointer. The default reference point of the top-level GOB is the upper-left corner of the window associated with the application program.

Opcode.Description: Returns the mouse's x-coordinate within this GOB in pixels.
Returns the mouse's y-coordinate within a GOB in pixels.

Parameter.Name: gid
Parameter.Description: GOB to get mouse coordinates relative to

Opcode.Description: Returns the mouse's y-coordinate within this GOB in pixels.
Returns a unique ID
Returns x-coordinate of a GOB in pixels.

Parameter.Name: gid
Parameter.Description: The gid argument is the GOB ID of the GOB for which to return the x coordinate.

Opcode.Remarks: The x coordinate of a GOB is the horizontal distance between the referenced point of the GOB and the reference point of its parent GOB. The default reference point of the top-level GOB is the upper-left corner of the window associated with the application program.

Opcode.Description: Returns x-coordinate of this GOB in pixels.
Returns y-coordinate of a GOB in pixels.
Returns y-coordinate of this GOB in pixels.
Returns z order of a GOB

Parameter.Name: gid
Parameter.Description: The gid argument is the GOB ID of the GOB for which to return the z order.

Opcode.Remarks: The z-order of GOBs on screen determines their drawing precedence. Use ZGob and ZThis to determine the order of display.

Opcode.Description: Returns z-order of this GOB
Sets z-order of a GOB
Sets z-order of this GOB
Displays a frame of an animation for a specified length of time.

Parameter.Name: chid
Parameter.Description: Child ID of the bitmap to display as a frame.

Parameter.Name: lwX
Parameter.Description: Horizontal coordinate to display the frame at.

Parameter.Name: lwY
Parameter.Description: Vertical coordinate to display the frame at.

Parameter.Name: lwTime
Parameter.Description: Length of time to delay before the next display (1/60th second)

Opcode.Remarks: Use chid chidNil (OxFFFFFFFF) to avoid changing the GOB's appearance. This script keyword is useful for moving an object on screen or for polling for events. The lwX and lwY coordinates are relative to the upper-left corner of the container GOB and are based on the current GOB's reference point. The Cell command supports an implied pause or delay.

Opcode.Description: Shows a message box containing strings. Blocks execution until the message box is closed by the user.
Get a global property
Set a global property
Executes an external process. Returns a boolean.

Parameter.Name: Command
Parameter.Description: String ID of command to execute. Passed to CreateProcessA().

Parameter.Name: gid
Parameter.Description: GOB to get current frame from

Parameter.Name: chunk_tag
Parameter.Description: Type of sound to play. WAVE: 0x57415645. MIDS: 0x4d494453

Parameter.Name: chunk_number
Parameter.Description: Chunk number of the sound to play

Parameter.Name: repeat
Parameter.Description: Number of times to play. Zero will loop forever.

Opcode.Description: Returns the width of a GOB in pixels.
Returns the width of this GOB in pixels.
Returns the height of a GOB
Returns the height of this GOB
Writes integer values to the debugger. Returns immediately.
Writes strings to the debugger. Returns immediately.
Set the global sound volume
Get the global sound volume.
Set the mouse cursor to the hourglass
Returns the mouse cursor to the arrow.
